content.description: Start to the leftest most part of the lip from the start of Chunk! No Captain Chunk! Work your way across and follow the route above.

The crux is the first move from the start. Start is a sit start using the obvious crimps, 2 hand start, and feet off to the left. From there reach up with right hand to small block. Step over with right foot to make next move. several more moves to good top out.

 Caution: downed tree right at the base of the boulder

Sit start to Bend The Knee. Start left hand on jug, right hand on sidepull about level with head, and feet out left. Bump right hand up to small edge on the arete. Throw for block just right of the left hand start hold for Bend The Knee. Right hand up to decent crimp (same as 1st move of BTK). Rest of climb goes the same way as Bend The Knee but mantle to top out instead of using the ledge to the right.

 If this has been done before please let me know.

Start on a left hand crimp and a right hand slopey side pull. Move up to a decent crimp. Move left through a series of crimps. Do not use the ledge. After you get to the last crimp, set feet and make a large thrown to a jug on the left side of the boulder. Intermediary side pull or small crimp may be used to bump. Once at the jug, drop hand into the side sloper. Stick in a cheeky knee bar and throw to the right most edge. You may top out using the separate right boulder for feet.

Project in the Entrance Boulders. Start on the undercling side pull on the left, keep feet on the face. Work hands over a series of small crimps and throw to the slopper on the right, bring up left hand and top out...in theory. Still being projected guestimated as a V4/5
content.location: Found on the left hand side of Chunk! No Captain Chunk!

content.description: Same start as "Bend the Knee". Go up to the same crimp (or the slightly worse crimp above it) and instead of moving left, dyno directly to the finish of "Bend the Knee". Top out the same way.

Same start as "Bend the Knee". Follow the crimps to the left and make the same power move to the decent jug. Instead of falling into the sloper, this time, summon all the tension in your body to bring your hand to the top of the boulder. Once you grab the top, shuffle a bit to the right of the boulder to find the lip and top out.

pathTokens: Rocky Hollow Area at Garret Mountain

content.description: Small outcrop of boulders right near the entrance to Garret Mountain in between Weaseld Drift Rd and Park Rd. Area has two over hang boulders with several establish problems and one project still unfinish. There is also a warm up slab and other small outcrop with a with lines. Keep an eye out for deer when they are spooked they tend to run right through the area.
